greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists divisors d of n such that n divides d^n.
comment: Row n lists divisors of n that are divisible by A007947(n). - _Robert Israel_, Apr 27 2017
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10002 (rows 1 to 5250, flattened)
mathematica: Flatten[Table[Select[Range[n], Divisible[n, #] && Divisible[#^n, n] &], {n, 50}]] (* _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) [[u: u in [1..n] | Denominator(n/u) eq 1 and Denominator(u^n/n) eq 1]: n in [1..50]];
(PARI) for(n=1, 50, for(i=1, n, if(n%i==0 & (i^n)%n==0, print1(i,", "););); print();); \\ _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017
....print [i for i in range(1, n + 1) if n%i==0 and (i**n)%n==0] # _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017
xref: Cf. A000961 (1 together with k such that k divides p^k for some prime divisor p of k), A005361 (row length), A007774 (m such that m divides s^m for some semiprime divisor s of m), A007947 (smallest u such that u^n|n and n|u, or divisor k such that A000005(k) = 2^A001221(n)), A057723 (row sums), A066503 (difference between largest x and smallest y such that x^n|n, n|x, y^n|n and n|y).
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Mar 25 2017
